'''Vulpix''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''ロコン''' ''Rokon'') is a {{type|Fire}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation I]].

It [[Evolution|evolve]]s into {{p|Ninetales}} when exposed to a [[Fire Stone]].

In [[Alola]], Vulpix has a [[regional variant]] that is {{type|Ice}}. It evolves into Alolan Ninetales when exposed to an [[Ice Stone]].

==Biology==
[[File:Enta Vulpix one tail CBF.png|thumb|left|200px|A one-tailed Vulpix as seen in [[Pokémon Battle Frontier]]]]
Vulpix is a small, quadruped, fox-like Pokémon. It has red-brown pelt, brown, pupil-less eyes, large, pointed ears with dark brown insides, and six orange tails with curled tips. The tails grow hot as evolution approaches for this Pokémon. Vulpix also has curled locks of orange fur with bangs on top of its head. At birth, Vulpix has only one white tail, which apparently splits and grows more beautiful and warmer as it grows older. Vulpix has a cream underbelly, and brown feet with lighter brown paw pads.

Vulpix has a flame inside its body that never goes out, and is capable of manipulating fire to such precision as to create floating wisps of flame. When the temperature outside increases, it will expel flames from its mouths to prevent its body from overheating. Vulpix is known to feign injury to escape from opponents too powerful for it to defeat. Vulpix can be found most commonly in {{DL|List of Pokémon by habitat|Grassland Pokémon|grassy plains}}.

In the Alola region, Vulpix has adapted to snowy mountain peaks. Its fur has become snowy white. It has pale blue paws, blue eyes, and dark blue insides its ears. Its snout is more pronounced and pointed than that of non-Alolan Vulpix. The locks of hair on its head and its six tails are curlier with a wispy appearance. Alolan Vulpix is believed to have arrived in the region at the same time as humans, but moved to the snow-capped mountain to avoid other Pokémon. It can be found in small packs of two to five individuals. Alolan Vulpix can expel breath as cold as -58&nbsp;°F (-50&nbsp;°C), which is capable of freezing anything. While it is not suited to warmer environments, its tail can produce ice to lower the surrounding temperature if needed.<ref>[http://www.pokemon-sunmoon.com/en-us/pokemon/alolan-vulpix/ Pokémon Sun and Moon]</ref> According to the Pokédex, an older name for Alolan Vulpix is Keokeo.

===In the main series===
====Major appearances====
=====[[Brock's Vulpix]]=====
{{an|Brock}} had a Vulpix that he obtained from [[Suzie]] in [[Kanto]] in ''[[EP028|Pokémon Fashion Flash]]''. In ''[[EP169|Beauty and the Breeder]]'', he returned it to her.

=====[[Snowy]]=====
An [[Regional variant|Alolan]] Vulpix debuted in ''[[SM013|Racing to a Big Event!]]'', where it hatched from an {{pkmn|Egg}} that {{an|Lillie}} primarily took care of. She gave the Egg the name "Snowy", and kept that name for the Vulpix that hatched from it. Despite her fear of Pokémon, Lillie caught Snowy in ''[[SM014|Getting to Know You!]]''.

=====Other=====
A Vulpix appeared in ''[[EP267|Love, Pokémon Style]]'', under the ownership of [[Macy]]. Vulpix found itself captured by {{TRT}}, but with the help of {{Ash}}, Vulpix was rescued.

A Vulpix appeared in ''[[AG150|May's Egg-Cellent Adventure!]]'', where it hatched from an Egg.

[[Samson Oak]] owns a Vulpix that appeared in ''[[SM014|Getting to Know You!]]''. It hatched from the Egg that was given to [[Delia]] by {{an|Professor Oak}} so it could be delivered to Samson in ''[[SM001|Alola to New Adventure!]]''.

An Alolan Vulpix appeared in a flashback in [[SM060]], under the ownership of {{OBP|Sara|SM060}}. By the events of that episode, it had evolved into an Alolan Ninetales.

====Minor appearances====
A Vulpix was among the Pokémon controlled by [[Cassidy]] and [[Butch]] in ''[[EP086|Pikachu Re-Volts]]''.

{{OBP|Ralph|EP100}} and {{OBP|Emily|EP100}} were both shown in a flashback to have once owned one Vulpix each in ''[[EP100|Wherefore Art Thou, Pokémon?]]''.

A Vulpix appeared in ''[[M02|The Power of One]]''.

A Vulpix appeared in ''[[M05|Pokémon Heroes: Latios & Latias]]'', under the ownership of an elderly woman.

A Vulpix was seen alongside its Trainer in a [[Pokémon Center]] in ''[[EP262|You're a Star, Larvitar!]]''.

A Vulpix appeared in the opening sequences of ''[[M06|Jirachi: Wish Maker]]'' and ''[[M08|Lucario and the Mystery of Mew]]''.

Multiple Vulpix appeared in the opening sequence of ''[[M07|Destiny Deoxys]]''.

A {{pkmn|Coordinator}}'s Vulpix appeared in ''[[AG143|The Saffron Con]]''.

A Vulpix appeared in ''[[DP077|Staging a Heroes' Welcome!]]'', under the ownership of a Pokémon Coordinator competing in the [[Wallace Cup]].

A Coordinator's Vulpix appeared in ''[[DP123|Old Rivals, New Tricks!]]'', where it was participating in the [[Sandalstraw Town]] [[Pokémon Contest]].

A Vulpix appeared in a fantasy in ''[[BW135|Mystery on a Deserted Island!]]'', when [[Alexa]] was telling {{Ash}} and {{ashfr}} that it belonged to a {{OBP|Pirate|BW135}}. It is revealed that after the pirate disappeared, Vulpix stayed on the {{OBP|Deserted Island|BW135|island}} where the treasure was hidden with the other Pokémon. It was revealed to have evolved into {{p|Ninetales}} afterwards.

A Vulpix appeared in ''[[XY001|Kalos, Where Dreams and Adventures Begin!]]''.

A Vulpix appeared in [[SS028]].

A Trainer's Vulpix appeared in ''[[SM017|Crystal-Clear Sleuthing!]]''.

A Trainer's Vulpix appeared in ''[[M20|I Choose You!]]''.

A Trainer's Alolan Vulpix appeared in ''[[SM038|Mimikyu Unmasked!]]''.

==In the manga==
===In the Magical Pokémon Journey manga===
[[File:Flannery Vulpix Adventures.png|thumb|200px|Vulpix in [[Pokémon Adventures]]]]
In [[Magical Pokémon Journey]], [[Kiaraway]], a Fire-type Pokémon Trainer, owns a female Vulpix. She is one of his most used Pokémon, first appearing with {{p|Cyndaquil}} in ''[[PPP50|Vulpix and Cyndaquil]]''. She is good friends with [[Coconut]].

===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
{{adv|Bill}} owns a Vulpix, which first appeared in ''[[PS059|Hitmonlee, Baby! (One More Time)]]''. He uses it as a guard for his house. It appeared again with him at the [[Pokémon Association]] while he was talking about the [[Gym Leader]]s in ''[[PS099|Sunkern Treasure]]''. In ''[[PS117|Slugging It Out With Slugma]]'', it appeared again with its Trainer while he was talking to {{adv|Professor Oak}}, however it kept being a nuisance during the conversation along with Bill's {{p|Exeggcute}}.

[[Flannery]] owns a Vulpix that first appeared in ''[[PS245|Bravo, Vibrava]]''. She used it to battle [[Shelly]]'s {{p|Ludicolo}}. Although it ended up getting defeated, it managed to disable Ludicolo's main attack, {{m|Nature Power}}, by using {{m|Grudge}} just before fainting.

The first [[Magma Admin Courtney]]'s {{p|Ninetales}} was a Vulpix at one point, and was used in {{pkmn|Contest}}s, as shown in a flashback in ''[[PS262|It All Ends Now III]]''.

===In the Pokémon Battle Frontier manga===
{{main|Enta's Vulpix}}
In [[Pokémon Battle Frontier]], the main character {{OBP|Enta|CBF}} has a Vulpix that is his first Pokémon.

==Trivia==
* The beta {{DL|Pokémon Red and Green beta|Pokémon names}} in {{2v2|Red|Blue}} listed Vulpix as ''Foxfire''.
* Vulpix can be seen as a parallel to {{p|Growlithe}}. Both are {{cat|Generation I Pokémon}} that evolve once via a [[Fire Stone]]. Vulpix is exclusive to {{game3|Red and Green|Pokémon Green|s}}, Blue, {{game3|Gold and Silver|Silver|s}}, {{game3|FireRed and LeafGreen|LeafGreen|s}}, and {{game3|HeartGold and SoulSilver|SoulSilver|s}} while Growlithe is to Red, {{pkmn|Blue Version (Japanese)|Blue (Japan)}}, Gold, FireRed, and HeartGold. Growlithe has a 75% chance of being male while Vulpix has a 75% of being female, they are both in the {{egg3|Field}}, can have {{a|Flash Fire}} as their Ability, and are yellow when {{Shiny}} from [[Generation III]] on. Furthermore, both are based on canines as well as animals of Japanese folklore: Vulpix from the {{wp|fox}} and ''{{wp|kitsune}}'', Growlithe from the {{wp|dog}} and ''{{wp|shisa}}''.
* Alolan Vulpix can be seen as a parallel to {{p|Sandshrew|Alolan Sandshrew}}. Both were initially introduced in [[Generation I]] and got [[Alola Form]]s in {{g|Sun and Moon}}. Both Pokémon are {{type|Ice}} with Vulpix being exclusive to Sun and Sandshrew being exclusive to Moon. Furthermore, both Pokémon evolve when exposed to an [[Ice Stone]].
* Vulpix is the only Pokémon with a base stat total of 299.
* Vulpix and {{p|Ninetales}} share their {{pkmn|category}} with {{p|Fennekin}}, {{p|Braixen}}, and {{p|Delphox}}. They are all known as the Fox Pokémon.
* Vulpix has the lowest base {{stat|HP}} of all {{type|Fire}} Pokémon.
* Alolan Vulpix is the only regional variant with a specific name — Keokeo.

===Origin===
Vulpix is based on a {{wp|red fox|fox}}, particularly the {{wp|kitsune}} of Japanese legend, which have many tails and can breathe fire. After living a long time, kitsune take on spirit forms, which may explain why Vulpix can learn {{type|Ghost}} moves.

Alolan Vulpix seems to be based on the {{wp|Arctic fox}}.

====Name origin====
Vulpix is a combination of ''vulpes'' ({{wp|Latin}} for fox) and ''six'' (referring to its six tails).

The Alolan name Keokeo comes from ''keʻokeʻo'' ({{wp|Hawaiian language|Hawaiian}} for white).

Rokon may be a combination of 六 ''roku'' (six) and 恨 ''kon'' (grudge, from the curse that {{p|Ninetales}}, its evolution, may cast on its foes), ''kon kon'' (the sound foxes make), コンロ ''konro'' ({{wp|gas stove}}), or ''ko'', an alternate reading of 狐 ''kitsune'' (fox).
